error.signature: dial tcp: socket: too many open files

verdict.summary: File descriptor limit reached. Common in HTTP clients without closing response bodies.

dead_ends.action: Increase ulimit to a very large value
dead_ends.why_fails: Just delays the problem â€” file descriptors are still leaking

dead_ends.action: Restart the process when limit is hit
dead_ends.why_fails: Hack that doesn't fix the leak

workarounds.action: Close HTTP response bodies: defer resp.Body.Close()
Close file handles, database connections, and other resources with defer
Increase ulimit as a temporary measure: ulimit -n 65536

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'dial tcp' is a system_error error while 'runtime error' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
